notebookllm documentation¶

class notebookllm.notebookllm.Notebook(filepath: str = None)¶

Bases: object

Represents a Jupyter Notebook and provides methods for interaction.

add_code_cell(source: str, position: int = None) → None¶

Adds a new code cell to the notebook.

Parameters:

  • source (str) – The code to add to the cell.

  • position (int, optional) – The position at which to insert the cell. If None, appends to end. Defaults to None.

add_markdown_cell(source: str, position: int = None) → None¶

Adds a new markdown cell to the notebook.

Parameters:

source – The markdown to add to the cell.

add_raw_cell(source: str, position: int = None, **kwargs) → None¶

Adds a new raw cell to the notebook.

Parameters:

  • source (str) – The content of the raw cell.

  • position (int, optional) – The position at which to insert the cell. If None, appends to end. Defaults to None.

  • **kwargs – Any additional arguments that need to passed to the raw cell such as metadata

property cells: List[Dict[str, Any]]¶

Returns a list of cell dictionaries.

Returns:

A list of dictionaries representing cells.

Return type:

List[Dict[str, Any]]

delete_cell(index: int) → None¶

Deletes a cell at the specified index.

Parameters:

index (int) – The index of the cell to delete.

Raises:

IndexError – If the given index is out of range.

edit_cell(index: int, source: str, cell_type: str = None) → None¶

Edits a cell at the specified index. :param index: The index of the cell to edit. :type index: int :param source: The new source for the cell :type source: str :param cell_type: The cell type to change the cell into (if desired). Defaults to None which keeps the cell type. :type cell_type: str, optional

Raises:

  • IndexError – If the given index is out of range.

  • ValueError – If cell_type is provided, but it isn’t a valid type

execute_cell(index: int, timeout: int = 60, iopub_timeout: int = 5) → Dict[str, List[str | Dict[str, Any]]]¶

Executes a code cell at the specified index and returns the output.

Parameters:

index (int) – The index of the code cell to execute.

Returns:

A dictionary containing execution output (stdout, stderr, display data), or an error message if the cell is not code.

Return type:

Dict[str, Any]

Raises:

IndexError – If the given index is out of range.

static from_plain_text(text: str) → Notebook¶

Converts text representation (.py,.txt or .r) into a notebook object

Args:

text: The plain text representation (.py,.txt or .r file) to be converted to a notebook

Returns:

The plain text representation of the notebook.

Return type:

Notebook

insert_cell_at_position(cell: Dict, position: int = None) → None¶

Inserts a cell at the specified position.

Parameters:

  • cell (Dict) – The cell to insert.

  • position (int, optional) – The position at which to insert the cell. If None, appends to the end. Defaults to None.

Raises:

ValueError – if the given postion is out of range

is_kernel_connected() → bool¶

Checks if a kernel client is available :returns: True if a kernel client is available, else False :rtype: bool

load_notebook_from_file(filepath: str) → NotebookNode¶

Loads a notebook from the given file path.

Parameters:

filepath (str) – The path to the .ipynb file.

Returns:

The loaded notebook object.

Return type:

nbformat.NotebookNode

Raises:

  • FileNotFoundError – If the specified file does not exist.

  • nbformat.reader.NotJSONError – If the file is not a valid JSON.

property metadata: Dict[str, Any]¶

Returns the notebook’s metadata.

Returns:

A dictionary containing metadata.

Return type:

Dict[str, Any]

save(filepath: str = None) → None¶

Saves the notebook to the specified file path.

Args:

filepath (str, optional): The file path to save the notebook to. If None, saves to the original file. Defaults to None.

Raises:

ValueError – If neither a file path is passed, or a file has not been specified upon initialization

set_metadata(key: str, value: Any) → None¶

Sets a metadata entry for the notebook.

Parameters:

  • key (str) – metadata key to be set

  • value (Any) – metadata value to set

start_kernel(kernel_name: str = 'python3')¶

Starts a Jupyter kernel for code execution.

Parameters:

kernel_name (str, optional) – The name of the kernel to start. Defaults to “python3”.

stop_kernel()¶

Stops the current kernel and releases resources.

to_plain_text() → str¶
Converts the notebook content to a simplified plain text (.py ,.txt or .r file) representation.

Each code and markdown cell is extracted into the string code cells are prefixed with ‘#CODE:’ markdown cells are prefixed with ‘#MARKDOWN:’

Returns:

The plain text representation of the notebook.

Return type:

str

cli.main()¶

Entry point for the notebookllm command-line tool.

Parses command-line arguments and performs the appropriate action based on the provided command.
